intro: Hieracium ossolanum, commonly known as the Swiss buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a single flower head that blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
